answers.author: Heidi Pruess
answers.text:
So in the broad view, Local Government strategic plans are sustainability plans...addressing all three pillars of sustainability.  If you are talking about "Environmental Sustainability", Mecklenburg County has adopted as part of it's strategic plan a focus on "Sustainable Community".  We have 5 indicies that are measured (air, water, waste, green space, and internal environmental leadership) and these measures are reported annually.  The County does not have jurisdiction over energy issues...so broadening our scope to address this community issue is a challege (although not insurmountable).  So the need to help local governments really define what sustainability means for them and how that fits into the larger community is the issue I see.  We are beginning to have that discussion.

author: Niel Curley
text:
According to the Breaking New Ground: Promoting Environmental and Energy Programs in Local Government report only 1 in 6 local governments are adopting plans and procedures to address sustainability issues in their community.  
http://transformgov.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/document/302842/breaking_new_ground_promoting_environmental_and_energy_programs_in_local_government
What are some ways your community is encouraging and addressing the issue of sustainability at the local level?
title: How is your community addressing sustainability issues?
